intro: Senecio kerdousianus, commonly known as the Karoo senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Senecio kerdousianus produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
